item.title: US sanctions Chinese firm for hacking firewalls in ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Chinese cybersecurity company Sichuan Silence and one of its employees for their involvement in a series of Ragnarok ransomware attacks targeting U.S. critical infrastructure companies and many other victims worldwide in April 2020. [...]

item.title: New Cleo zero-day RCE flaw exploited in data theft attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are actively exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in Cleo managed file transfer software to breach corporate networks and conduct data theft attacks. [...]

item.title: Inside the incident: Uncovering an advanced phishing attack
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Varonis
item.description: Recently, Varonis investigated a phishing campaign in which a malicious email enabled a threat actor to access the organization. This blog post will reveal the tactics used to avoid detection and share what was discovered during the investigation. [...]

item.title: Microsoft 365 outage takes down Office web apps, admin center
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating a widespread and ongoing Microsoft 365 outage impacting Office web apps and the Microsoft 365 admin center. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers use Visual Studio Code tunnels for remote access
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Chinese hackers targeting large IT service providers in Southern Europe were seen abusing Visual Studio Code (VSCode) tunnels to maintain persistent access to compromised systems. [...]

item.title: Ransomware attack hits leading heart surgery device maker
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Artivion, a leading manufacturer of heart surgery medical devices, has disclosed a November 21 ransomware attack that disrupted its operations and forced it to take some systems offline. [...]

item.title: OpenWrt Sysupgrade flaw let hackers push malicious firmware images
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A flaw in OpenWrt's Attended Sysupgrade feature used to build custom, on-demand firmware images could have allowed for the distribution of malicious firmware packages. [...]

item.title: Ubisoft fixes Windows 11 24H2 conflicts causing game crashes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has now partially lifted a compatibility hold blocking the Windows 24H2 update on systems with some Ubisoft games after the French video game publisher has fixed bugs causing crashes, freezes, and audio issues. [...]

item.title: Radiant links $50 million crypto heist to North Korean hackers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Radiant Capital now says that North Korean threat actors are behind the $50 million cryptocurrency heist that occurred after hackers breached its systems in an October 16 cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Outdated Google Workspace Sync blocks Windows 11 24H2 upgrades
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft now blocks the Windows 11 24H2 update on computers with outdated Google Workspace Sync installs because they're causing Outlook launch issues. [...]

item.title: Cybercrime gang arrested after turning Airbnbs into fraud centers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Eight members of an international cybercrime network that stole millions of Euros from victims and set up Airbnb fraud centers were arrested in Belgium and the Netherlands. [...]

item.title: Romanian energy supplier Electrica hit by ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Electrica Group, a key player in the Romanian electricity distribution and supply market, is investigating a ransomware attack that was still "in progress" earlier today. [...]

item.title: QR codes bypass browser isolation for malicious C2 communication
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Mandiant has identified a novel method to bypass contemporary browser isolation technology and achieve command-and-control C2 operations. [...]
